context: Municipal utility company planning integration of 200MW solar and wind capacity into existing grid infrastructure. Current grid designed for 80% fossil fuel base load with limited renewable intermittency management.

request.purpose: Grid modernization including energy storage systems, smart inverters, advanced metering, and grid management software
request.justification: Meet 40% renewable target by 2030, reduce grid instability costs by 60%, comply with state renewable mandates, improve service reliability

decision_process.outcome: Identified optimal integration strategy with 95% renewable capacity utilization
Secured $120M in green bonds, $60M in federal grants

business_impact.expected_outcome: 40% renewable integration achieved, 60% reduction in grid instability events, improved customer satisfaction, enhanced regulatory compliance
business_impact.projected_value: $45M annual savings in fuel costs, $25M in avoided outage costs

lessons_learned: Comprehensive stakeholder engagement prevents opposition, phased implementation reduces technical risks, performance-based regulation provides financial incentives
